channel.title: Home on Aleksi Tarvainen
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Aleksi Tarvainen

item.title: Vaalikartta
item.description: Vaalikartta is a web app to explore data about Finnish parliamentary elections from 1983 to 2019. It also includes some information about each municipality and cabinets. It is a product of the course Open Data Student Projects (TIEA207). We developed the app in a group of four students. I took care of extracting most of the data and developing the backend API. We didn't have any designated project manager, but our project board was managed mostly by me.

item.title: Homepage
item.description: I started working on this site on 2019-09-04. The site is built with Hugo using its various functions (eg. templates). The theme is my homebrew. I call it Minimus for being minimal (though barebones would describe it equally well). The contents of this site will probably reflect my own interests. You can read more about those on the about page. The site is hosted on Github Pages. I hope you enjoy your stay!

item.title: RPG-Dice
item.description: I built this little app, when I was working on Helsinki university's Fullstack MOOC 2019. I wanted to try out how Typescript pairs with React. Maybe Typescripts best parts wont't show, when making such small apps, but I saw it's potential. Defining types gives me a sense of safety and I much prefer compilation errors to runtime errors, which really don't hint at eg. what could cause something to be ‘undefined’.

item.title: About me
item.description: About me I'm a third-year student at University of Jyväskylä majoring in information technology, minor in mathematics. I'm interested in programming, audio and music; ideally combining all three. I've discovered Linux to be a cool thing and I like to learn about it's inner workings. As low-level languages like C and C++ are used a lot in audio programming, it's probably no surprise that systems level programming intrigues me as well.
